page.title: 17Clubs the Penn YWCA
page.content: The Y.W.C.A. is a club which is on the Warstones estate. It is on Claverly Drive, Claverly is the name of a local village. The club is open in the school holidays. Teenagers and younger children usually go there. The Y.W.C.A. stands for Young Women's Christian Association. There are a lot of sports type things that you are able to play. There is snooker, table tennis, tennis, pogo sticks, football, etc. There is a playground at the back of the club where the outdoor games may be played. At the club they sell sweets and pop, for pop it is only 10p a can and sweets are really cheap as well. Some girls in our class do ballet there and tap as there is a stage. They do disco dancing as well. It only costs 5p to get in.
